meta.content: News and updates about the Mount Olive Township School District from Dr. Robert R. Zywicki, Superintendent of Schools
meta.title: The Marauder Memo

p.span: News and updates about the Mount Olive Township School District from Dr. Robert R. Zywicki, Superintendent of Schools

span.style: color: black; font-family: "georgia" , "times new roman" , serif; font-size: 11pt; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre;

div.span: Updates for MO families on the twentieth day of the COVID-19 health-related closure:

span.style: font-family: "georgia" , "times new roman" , serif;
background-color: white; white-space: pre-wrap;

span.span: Mount Olive High School is a 2020 Best High School, based on rankings that U.S. News & World Report published this morning. MOHS is ranked in the top 10% of all U.S. high schools:

a.style: background-color: white; color: #168eea; outline: none; padding: 0px; text-decoration-line: none; white-space: pre-wrap;

span.style: background-color: white; white-space: pre-wrap;

span.span: . Such an exceptional distinction for MO is a product of the teamwork and collaboration that exists between the board, faculty, staff, and administration.

span.style: background-color: white; white-space: pre-wrap;
font-family: "georgia" , "times new roman" , serif;

a.span: Click for important information about 3rd and 4th marking period grading for MOMS and MOHS.

span.style: font-family: "georgia" , "times new roman" , serif;

li.span: Please complete this linked form by 3:00 PM on THURSDAY, 4-23-20, if you have a child in Preschool or Kindergarten and do not have home internet access and/or did not pick up a device for your child already. We will work to provide your child with a Chromebook that is web-enabled. Pickup will occur at the Sandshore Elementary School on the following days: Last Names (A-M) MONDAY, April 27, 2020 from 10:00 AM until 12:00 PM. Last Names (N-Z) WEDNESDAY, April 29, 2020 10:00 AM until 12:00 PM. Extra Distribution Day FRIDAY, May 1, 2020 10:00 AM until 12:00 PM.

span.style: font-family: "georgia" , "times new roman" , serif;

li.span: Please complete this linked form by 3:00 PM on THURSDAY, 4-23-20, if you have a child in Grades 1-8 and do not have home internet access and/or did not pick up a device for your child already. We will work to provide your child with a Chromebook that is web-enabled. Pickup will occur at the Sandshore Elementary School on the following days: Last Names (A-M) MONDAY, April 27, 2020 from 10:00 AM until 12:00 PM. Last Names (N-Z) WEDNESDAY, April 29, 2020 10:00 AM until 12:00 PM. Extra Distribution Day FRIDAY, May 1, 2020 10:00 AM until 12:00 PM.

span.style: font-family: "georgia" , "times new roman" , serif; white-space: pre-wrap;

li.span: Based on the directive of Governor Murphy, all MOTSD schools are operating under a health-related closure until at least 5/15. Therefore, home instruction will be continue as per the MOTSD Health-Related Closure Plan (tinyurl.com/MOhealthplan).

span.style: font-family: "georgia" , "times new roman" , serif; white-space: pre-wrap;

li.span: I met with the senior class officers yesterday morning and we will be releasing contingency plans for end of year events on Monday 4/27.

vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

li.span: Reminders regarding digital learning:

span.style: font-family: "georgia" , "times new roman" , serif; white-space: pre-wrap;

li.span: Students are expected to check their course-respective Google Classrooms on a daily basis to receive updates and assignments from their teachers.

span.style: font-family: "georgia" , "times new roman" , serif; white-space: pre-wrap;

li.span: Students are strongly encouraged to make themselves available for and participate during the synchronous learning opportunities facilitated by their teachers via Google Hangouts. New content is being delivered and these sessions will help students continue to make academic progress.

span.style: font-family: "georgia" , "times new roman" , serif; white-space: pre-wrap;

li.span: If students need extra help they can schedule an office hours appointment with their teachers.

span.style: font-family: "georgia" , "times new roman" , serif; white-space: pre-wrap;

li.span: If an extenuating circumstance such as illness, family responsibilities, or work dynamics prevent participation in synchronous sessions, please email your teacher, counselor, and/or building administration.

span.style: font-family: "georgia" , "times new roman" , serif; white-space: pre-wrap;

li.span: If you require additional assistance, please do not hesitate to reach out as follows:

span.style: font-family: "georgia" , "times new roman" , serif;
vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

span.span: The MOTSD Guidance Department will be available to our students by appointment each day 9 a.m. - 2 p.m.

span.span: We are working very closely with Mayor Greenbaum, MO Township Administrator Tatarenko, and the MO Health Department to ensure our MOTSD families are as healthy and safe as possible. Contact the MO Department of Health COVID-19 hotline at (862) 419-4300 with any suspected cases. In an effort to respond to the many questions and concerns raised by our residents, the Township has established a COVID-19 email address for general questions regarding the virus, Township preparation and response:

li.span: With the exception of MOMS, all MOTSD buildings, fields, and grounds are closed to all staff, students, and community members.

span.style: font-family: "georgia" , "times new roman" , serif; white-space: pre-wrap;

li.span: All registered MOTSD students who qualify for free and/or reduced lunch can pick up boxed breakfasts and lunches Monday, Wednesday, and Friday this week at Mount Olive Middle School from 7:30 a.m. to 9:30 a.m.

span.style: font-family: "georgia" , "times new roman" , serif; white-space: pre-wrap;

li.a: The Facebook Live Parent University originally scheduled for today has been rescheduled to tomorrow at noon.

span.style: font-family: "georgia" , "times new roman" , serif; white-space: pre-wrap;

li.span: All registered MOTSD students who qualify for free and/or reduced lunch can pick up boxed meals Monday, Wednesday, and Friday at Mount Olive Middle School from 7:30 a.m. to 9:30 a.m.

During the health-related closure, our faculty will make accommodations for share-time students that may include scheduling small group and individualized office hours to provide appropriate updates, support, and instructional guidance. MOHS counselors will be working with MOHS teachers to develop personalized learning plans to meet individual student needs.

li.span: Based on the executive order of Governor Murphy, all MOTSD schools are operating under a health-related closure until further notice. If the health-related closure is still in effect, home instruction will resume on April 20th.
